lines.text: Hi, I'm Brad. Frosty beverage?

[grinding is foot into Jory's chest]
Your stud days are over, pretty boy!

[outside Claude's house]
Come on out here! You, who've been porkin' my wife!

[to Dr. Palmer]
Son of a bitch! You son of a bitch! You've been porkin' my wife!

[keeping Reed and Claude from attacking Randy]
Leave him alone. It's not him.

[holding up his right hand, limp at the wrist]
Kid's a homo.
I had a Letter to Penthouse staring me right in the face, and I let it go.

[of Joe's secretary]
Hey, that's not bad. Porkin' her?
I'm a happily married man, Harry. At least, I used to be.
I like actual food, not fiber. Fuck fiber. I want grease, I like red meat...
You are not the regular American woman, and I am not the regular delivery boy.
Oh, my God! You're not?

[getting turned on]
No. He asked me to come here and say we have no more anchovies, but I cannot lie to you, my dove. I have MANY anchovies for you.
I've been having nightmares.
About what?
Husbands.
Me, too.
Oh, my God. You're just a boy. I'm sorry I... I don't date boys.

[seeing Randy rejected]
For what it's worth, I thought she made a big mistake. It took a lot of nerve to go up to a complete stranger like that and ask her out. I admire that.
Thanks. I have to go kill myself now. Excuse me.
Don't worry. I'm not going to bite you. Not over coffee, anyway.
[Joe reads a note dropped by Randy that accompanied a new fashionable jacket delivered by Tony]
"Dear, Randy. Of course I'd prefer you naked, but if you MUST wear something it should be the best. Love, Alex." Diane!
Yeah!
Diane, our son... is a fruit.
[Joe discovers Jenny's suitcase full of underwear in Randy's room]
Come on, Diane! Our son is dressing up in ladies underwear. This is a problem! He needs professional help!
No, what he needs are sympathetic parents who let him know how much they love him.
Let's see how sympathetic you are when he wants to borrow your makeup.
I have fantasy.
[Diane overhears Randy on the phone with Jenny but thinks he's on the phone with a gay lover]
I want another chance. My life is a mess without you. Yeah, I know. I'm not ashamed of you. I'm proud. I'm gonna tell my parents about you. And I really want them to meet you.
Ah, you... you want me to fix you a... drink or somethin'?
If I wanted a drink I would have hired a bartender!
I know this is probably against your professional code, but can I ask you a personal question?
Sure.

Well, it's just that... this isn't what I imagined. I... was angry and I wanted to get back at my husband, and I guess I kind of expected sort of a Wham, Bam, Thank You, Ma'am, but... you're not like that at all.
You're worth every penny.
Jen? Yeah, uh, well... I've been doin' a lot of thinkin' 'bout what you said back at school, about how I, uh, don't know how to treat a woman. Well, you're right but, you know, I am workin' on it.
Multiple fractures. Internal hemorrhaging. We need immediate x-rays.
Too late for that. We've got to open him right up.
Whatever you say, Dr. Palmer.
Doctor...? Dr. Pa... Dr. Reed Palmer?
That's right, Randy. I believe you know my wife.

[restraining anesthesiologist]
No anesthetic!
In Genova a husband come after me with a butcher knife. We fight, we fight. I hit him to the ground. I bite his ear off. He don't bother me no more.

[handing over a ruined boxed pizza]
You've got to deliver this to the Wilshile Motel, room 214.
But it is all broken. The tip will be very small.
Just take me to the bus station.
Okay. Okay. I just have to make one stop first.
Where?
Well, I've got to save my parents' marriage.
